org.omancode.util.beans
Class BeanPropertyInspector

java.lang.Object
  org.omancode.util.beans.BeanPropertyInspector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<BeanPropertyInspector.Property>
public class BeanPropertyInspector
extends Object
implements Iterable<BeanPropertyInspector.Property>

Inspects a bean and provides its property names and types. If the property method generates an exception it will silently ignore the property. Provides separate lists of property names and property types, as well as an iterator that returns BeanPropertyInspector.Property objects containing a name and type. Can be directed to return the boxed equivalent of primitive types for properties that return primitive types.

Version:
$Revision: 15 $
Author:
Oliver Mannion

Constructor Detail

BeanPropertyInspector

public BeanPropertyInspector(Object bean,
                             Class<?> stopClass)
                      throws IntrospectionException
Construct a property inspector for the supplied bean. Primitive types are returned as primitive types, not boxed types.

Parameters:
bean - bean to inspect.
stopClass - Columns are created for all getter methods that are defined by stopClass's subclasses. stopClass's getter methods and superclass getter methods are not converted to columns in the dataframe.
Throws:
IntrospectionException - if problem during reflection.

BeanPropertyInspector

public BeanPropertyInspector(Object bean,
                             Class<?> stopClass,
                             boolean reportBoxedPrimitive)
                      throws IntrospectionException
Construct a property inspector for the supplied bean.

Parameters:
bean - bean to inspect.
stopClass - Columns are created for all getter methods that are defined by stopClass's subclasses. stopClass's getter methods and superclass getter methods are not converted to columns in the dataframe.
reportBoxedPrimitive - whether bean properties returning a primitive type should report these as a boxed type, eg: java.lang.Integer instead of int.
Throws:
IntrospectionException - if problem during reflection.

getNamesAssignableFrom

public List<String> getNamesAssignableFrom(Class<?> cls)
A list of property names that are assignable from the supplied class type cls. ie: those properties that are either the same as, or are a superclass or superinterface of, the class or interface represented by the specified cls parameter.

Parameters:
cls - class to test for
Returns:
list of property names assignable from cls.
See Also:
Class.isAssignableFrom(Class)

boxedPrimitiveType

public final Class<?> boxedPrimitiveType(Class<?> primitiveClass)
Returns the boxed equivalent of a primitive type class. If the supplied class is not a primitive class, returns it as is.

Parameters:
primitiveClass - a primitive type class, eg: int.
Returns:
boxed version of the primitive type, eg: if primitiveType is int, returns java.lang.Integer.
